syllabus:
**English III – English for Science and Technology**

Fall 2020

**INSTRUCTOR**  Ann Wan-Hsin Lee 李婉歆 (annlee@ntnu.edu.tw)

**COURSE DESCRIPTION**

The goal of this course is to help students develop their English proficiency so that they will be able to comprehend and use English in the courses they study in their major and in their daily lives. Through a series of talks/presentations, discussions, and projects, students are also expected to learn to think critically about the issues addressed in class.

*   For each topic, the course materials will be available on Moodle. Students are expected to preview the course materials.

**How-to****: experiment and demonstration (4 people in one group)**

Before the presentation

1.  study how something is done,
2.  make sure that you can show/teach your classmates how to do it in English,
3.  prepare a handout with useful English vocabulary phrases and thought-provoking questions and
4.  discuss with Ann ONE WEEK before your presentation.

On the presentation day

1.  give a brief introduction,
2.  show and teach your classmate how it works,
3.  answer questions from your classmates, and
4.  go through the handout and lead group discussions.

**Movie Reviews****: presentation (4 people in one group)**

Clips from movies, sit-coms, TED-talk, and news clips are fine.

1.  pick a science movie/sit-com/news report on an issue/discovery
2.  introduce this movie to your classmates
3.  prepare a transcript (or a script) with useful expressions
4.  share with classmates why you like the movie

**Quizzes**

We will have three quizzes this semester. Each quiz will have five multiple questions/yes-no questions. Two of your best performances will account for 10% of your final grade.

**REQUIREMENTS & RULES**

1.  You will be asked to work in pairs and in groups. Please be a responsible partner.
2.  Attendance is important. Please show up on time.
3.  A notification of absence form has to be submitted online (學生請假系統). It is also the students’ own responsibility to catch up with the class after their absence.
4.  Please make sure that you have your Moodle account and check both the course site and your email regularly. Not receiving a notice/an email is NOT an excuse for absence or late submission.
